description: Tender Indian-spiced potato cakes, lightly browned and served with a kicky chutney. All the flavors of samosas, made easy right at home. And they're vegan too!
keywords: potato cakes, potato cakes recipe, Samosa Cakes, Samosa Cakes with Apple Chutney, Samosas recipe
name: Samosa Cakes with Apple Chutney
recipeIngredient: 1 large tart apple (such as Granny Smith, peeled and finely diced (about 2 cups)
2 serrano peppers (seeds and ribs removed and minced)
1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes (about 3 medium, diced into 1-inch cubes)
2 1/2 tablespoons grapeseed oil (or other neutral-flavored cooking oil, divided)
1/2 cup roasted and salted peanuts (coarsely chopped)
1/2 cup frozen peas (thawed (or cooked fresh peas)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the apple, chilies, ginger, vinegar, brown sugar and salt in a small saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to a simmer. Allow to simmer, uncovered, until the apple is tender and most of the liquid has cooked off, about 20 minutes, while you begin working on the samosa cakes. Once the chutney is finished cooking, let it cool and then stir in the cilantro.
